description: A systematic approach to technical documentation with four quadrants: tutorials, how-to guides, reference, and explanation.
rules: Use the four-quadrant structure: tutorials (learning-oriented), how-to guides (goal-oriented), reference (information-oriented), and explanation (understanding-oriented)
Keep strict separation between documentation types - don't mix tutorials with reference material
Tutorials should be beginner-friendly with step-by-step instructions that always work
How-to guides solve specific problems for users with some experience
Reference documentation should be comprehensive, accurate, and structured around code organization
Explanation provides context, background, and the 'why' behind design decisions
Cross-link between quadrants appropriately but maintain type boundaries
Test tutorials with complete beginners to ensure they work reliably
Use consistent formatting and structure within each documentation type
